sub_topic: Probability of winning a game of chance
message_1: A carnival game involves selecting one card out of a deck of 52 cards. If you select the ace of spades, you win a prize. What is the probability of winning the prize in a single attempt?
message_2:
There is only 1 ace of spades in a deck of 52 cards. Therefore, the probability of selecting the ace of spades in a single attempt is 1 out of 52, which can be written as a fraction:

Probability = 1/52

As a decimal, this is approximately 0.0192 or 1.92%.
